column4: Name of acid present in Chili?
column10: Capsaicin is an active component of chili peppers, which are plants belonging to the genus Capsicum. It is an irritant for mammals, including humans, and produces a sensation of burning in any tissue with which it comes into contact.

column4: Name the acid which make tears when cutting onions?
column10: Cut onions emit certain compounds which cause the lachrymal glands in the eyes to become irritated, releasing tears. Chopping an onion causes damage to cells which allows enzymes called alliinases to break down amino acid sulfoxides and generate sulfenic acids.

column4: Which of the following vegetable has cholesterol-lowering ability?
column10: Kale has been found to contain a group of resins known as bile acid sequestrants, which have been shown to lower cholesterol and decrease absorption of dietary fat. Steaming significantly increases these bile acid binding properties.

column4: Which of the following is sweeter in taste?
column10: Parsnips resemble carrots and can be used in similar ways but they have a sweeter taste, especially when cooked.

column4: Which country is the largest producer of garlic?
column10: Garlic is grown globally, but China is by far the largest producer of garlic, with around 20 million tonnes (44 billion pounds) grown annually, accounting for over 81% of world output. India is the second largest producer of Garlic.

column4: Which gives protection against Colorectal Cancer?
column10: Gingerols, the main active components in ginger and the ones responsible for its distinctive flavor, may also inhibit the growth of human colorectal cancer cells,
